[bq="trashboat"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552eee866368727531ae1900#post_552eee866368727531ae1900
You're bringing that kind of logic into a verse where there's a man who literally eats monsters and a man in a dog costume is one of the strongest men on earth.[/bq]
I'm just saying; super heroes in real life would die like within five minutes.

Like if superman was real just dump a ton of liquid nitrogen on him; even if he didn't die he would be in a coma or be blind forever or such.  Death by liquid nitrogen is not pretty.

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552ef1806368721daa791600#post_552ef1806368721daa791600
Carbon based life forms that are primarily composed of water would regardless be weak to low temperatures.  In order for such a lifeform to survive such low temperatures it would have to have fur to insulate itself from the low temperatures, but on the other hand fur would insulate against low temperatures from gases not liquids.


Basically: is it a carbon based lifeform that is primarily composed of water?
No)then continue
Yes)it would die from a liquid nitrogen bath.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552efa19636872260f550400#post_552efa19636872260f550400
Not really.

He's unrealistically strong without even trying, But what he can actually do is pretty well defined. (He can't do anything that a normal human can't do on some level.)

Basically, He can punch hard enough to negate a planet busting laser and part the clouds from japan to north america without being 100% serious, But he can't shoot lasers or fly.
